sentence.text: The design of multitarget ligands for chronic and neuropathic pain.
Monodrug therapy has been used with success to fight various pathologies
When one medicine fails, co-administration of two or more drugs at the same time may be successfully applied in the treatment of infections, hypertension, HIV and in many other fields
This approach has some weakness related to the pharmacokinetic of the two different substances administered, side effects, possible drug-drug interaction
Bivalent ligand approach would maintain the strength of the multidrug therapy (synergistic effect, lower doses, and little side effects) and overcome the weakness of a co-administration
In this review we have described the state-of-the-art of the multitarget approach for the control of pain
Several approaches adopted by different research groups and future perspectives have been discussed
